name: places/ChIJbxEpSHhZwokRy0E6XKUyNPk
formattedAddress: 630 E 6th St, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 630 E 6th St, New York, NY 10009-6894, USA

editorialSummary.text: Compact botanical garden with hundreds of plants & flowers plus a small pond.

originalText.text:
This little hidden escape, tucked between building in Manhattan, is an amazing getaway from the intensity of the city. You won’t even remember you’re in Manhattan.

It’s not perfect, however. There are parts of the garden that aren’t super well kept. Not only that, but the tree house (kinda the main attraction of this spot) can only have 4 people in it, and it will likely be occupied. Maybe on an off time, it’ll be empty.

Either way, it’s a beautiful spot to hang out and just relax.

originalText.text: One of a few beautiful community gardens in the area but this one is special because it has a treehouse inside! It’s an awesome space with beautiful terrace, lots of seating area to sit and enjoy the nice weather outside in the summer, highly recommend you come and check it out

text.text: One of a few beautiful community gardens in the area but this one is special because it has a treehouse inside! It’s an awesome space with beautiful terrace, lots of seating area to sit and enjoy the nice weather outside in the summer, highly recommend you come and check it out

originalText.text: Such cute garden and relaxing, just be prepared to stand in a long queue if you want to see the tree house.. green in the ciry,i love it

text.text: Such cute garden and relaxing, just be prepared to stand in a long queue if you want to see the tree house.. green in the ciry,i love it

authorAttribution.displayName: By the Rising Of the Moon

originalText.text: Hidden gem of a mini park. Multiple little semi hidden benches and chairs. There is a stone table. Lake with fish. Little second story reading room with books and binders to read and write in, respectively. Only four are allowed in this room at a time which makes sense given its very small size. Under the second story is a little sitting area with notices and a calendar. There are grape vines growing over a long trellis with benches underneath. This is a well cared for little spot that is easy to miss. The only downside is how short of a time it is open to the public on weekdays. 4pm to 7pm. They allow dogs, but they must be on a leash.

originalText.text: What a little treasure in the East Village. This is the perfect place to hide from the busy whir of the city. Bring a drink and a book and sit in the tiny gazebo hidden by lush greenery or in the "treehouse" with its lovely seating. Or just hang out on one of the benches or chairs around the delightful garden that is sure to attract faeries of all ages. Open hours may differ slightly from those listed. I went on a Monday at 6pm, as I was just passing by and was surprised to see the gate open...even though they list Mondays as closed.
